tool.name: TBL to GBF Converter
tool.description: Convert a tbl and corresponding fasta file into NCBI's .gbf format
tool.command:
python $__tool_directory__/tbl2asn.py #if $file_type and $file_type is not None: --filetype "$file_type" #end if
#if $verify and $verify is not None: --output "$verify" #end if
#if $tbl_in and $tbl_in is not None: --tblFile "$tbl_in" #end if
#if $fasta_in and $fasta_in is not None: --fsaFile "$fasta_in" #end if
#if $sbt_in and $sbt_in is not None: --sbtFile "$sbt_in" #end if

param.name: tbl_in
param.label: Input tbl file
param.help: Input tbl file with location and typ of features.

param.name: fasta_in
param.label: Input fasta file
param.help: Input fasta file with genome data.

param.name: sbt_in
param.label: Input sbt file
param.help: Input sbt file with template data.

param.name: file_type
param.label: Fasta file format.
param.option: Fasta Delta, di Fasta Delta with Implicit Gaps

tool.help:
**Overview**
Tbl2asn_ creates a GenBank file out of a tbl feature table and its corresponding fasta genome data.
.. _Tbl2asn: http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/genbank/tbl2asn2/
------
**Input**
The first input file has to be a tbl file. The second input file has to be a fasta file with sequences associated to the tbl file. You can also specify a template file (.sbt).
------
**Output**
The output will be a NCBI .gbf file and a corresponding .val validation file.
------
**tbl2asn parameters**
The standalone, command-line version of tbl2asn uses the following parameters::
-t path to the template file -p path to the directory of the input files -a specifies file type s = FASTA set l = Fasta + Gap Alignment z = Fasta with Gap Lines d = Fasta Delta, di Fasta Delta with Implicit Gaps -V validation v = validates data records b = generates GenBank flatfiles r = Validate without Country Check)
